abstract: The total value of technology deals in the third quarter fell 26 percent from second quarter, although it was up 21 percent from the depressed third quarter of 2009.
snippet: The total value of technology deals in the third quarter fell 26 percent from second quarter, although it was up 21 percent from the depressed third quarter of 2009.
lead_paragraph: While there have been a number of notable technology deals recently, the sector is hardly experiencing a boom in mergers and acquisitions. The total value of technology deals in the third quarter fell 26 percent from second quarter. Still, the M.&A. market was stronger than in the depressed third quarter of 2009, when the economy was emerging from one of the worst recessions on record.

headline.main: Tech Deals Percolate, but There’s No M.&A. Boom
